revised_title: Observations on the Cerebro-Spinal Fluid in the Human Subject
tldr: The authors present a case study of a young woman suffering from continuous dripping of cerebrospinal fluid from her nose. They discuss the chemical examination of the fluid and the possibility of spontaneous escape of cerebrospinal fluid from the nose, which has previously only been known to occur following traumatic injury to the cribriform plate of the ethmoid bone.
